fields.name: content
fields.description:
This resolver is intended to be used when random content data are needed.
It should be used with most common use cases like articles, audios, videos etc.
Designed to be friendly for easy content page renders on the client
so includes many header / footer metadata that sometimes can be different per content context.
Whenever possible, please try to always use with language provided, for performance reasons.

fields.name: contents
fields.description: Batch get for multiple contents sharing same fragment definition. Besides that same as 'contents' resolver

fields.name: contentsByType
fields.description: Advanced batch get with option to use additional simple, but dynamic model field filters

fields.name: topStoriesNavigation
fields.description:
Resolver that allows to get top story navigation data (mostly used e.g. for page headers) without reference to any specific content
(those are also available as part of association aspect on most of usual contents)
This one works fully correct only for ROAD, this is why it is deprecated.

fields.name: topStoriesNavigations
fields.description:
Resolver intended to be used mostly for retrieving all possible DW languages and references to start pages of those.
This one works fully correct only for ROAD, this is why it is deprecated.

fields.name: playoutRootNavigation
fields.description:
Resolver that allows to get ap specific root navigation data (mostly used e.g. for page headers) without reference to any specific content
(those are also available as part of association aspect on most of usual contents)

fields.name: playoutRootNavigations
fields.description: Resolver intended to be used mostly for retrieving all possible DW languages in specific app and references to start pages of those.

fields.name: configurableLinks
fields.description:
This Query is used to fetch all configured links for an app in specific language by arguments '$lang' and '$appName'. 
All links are configured in langConfig.

fields.name: footer
fields.description:
Retrieve footer data without having a reference to a content. Most usual contents have those attached
over FooterAspect and available directly at content graph

fields.name: betaSurvey
fields.description: Not in real use since there is no beta page now.

fields.name: breakingNews
fields.description:
Resolver delivers breaking news that can be shown in apps. This resolver has a very low cache time and enforces
such low cache time on whole graph so for most use cases should be used as separate query to allow efficient caching.

fields.name: livestreamChannels
fields.description:
Resolver is an entry point for livestream contents. It is not available over usual "content" resolver
due to some differences in the data model and how those data get retrieved (partially also due to historical reasons)

fields.name: azIndex
fields.description:
Resolver exposes data for az-index pages. Most important are the auto topic groups (mostly alphabet based, determined automatically from the data)
and the topics themselves that match the current topic group selection. It is a separate resolver because there is no real content
in CMS to backup those

fields.name: programsOverview
fields.description:
Resolver exposes data for program overview pages. Most important are audio and video programs determined
by CMS data, however program overview itself does not exist in CMS model, so it requires custom handling here in API

fields.name: headlinesOverview
fields.description:
Resolver exposes data for headlines overview pages. Those do not exist in CMS model, so require custom handling here in API.
Inside you can e.g. find a resolver to retrieve contents published in last 7 days.

fields.name: searchPage
fields.description:
Resolver exposes data for search pages. Those do not exist in CMS model, so require custom handling here in API.
Inside you can e.g. find tracking information.

fields.name: privacySettings
fields.description: Resolver exposes data for privacy settings (CMP) pages. Again just emulated content here for API and consistency needs (e.g. for tracking)

fields.name: peachExperimentContents
fields.description:
Resolver allows to easily connect to PEACH API and query metadata of experiments results.
Allows to e.g. render those as teasers as long as PEACH endpoint follows proper contract.

fields.name: i18nByLang
fields.description: Load your translations here if you know the language.

fields.name: today
fields.description:
Allows to load current day information with correct localized dates etc
It returns an array of days to be ready in case user is in some time zone where the day is already a different one or if
the day will change with next few shows being watched

fields.name: config
fields.description: You should find here all configuration values required by your app that require to be managed and cannot stay hardcoded in the clients.

args.name: types
args.description: One or more desired model types

args.name: offset
args.description: Offset value for pagination, must be >=0, defaults to 0

args.name: amount
args.description: Amount of items for pagination, must be > 0, defaults to 10, max. is 50

args.name: fields
args.description: Used in special cases to fetch only given fields

fields.name: isLive
fields.description:
This resolver checks if the language is live for the given subdomain of content.
This is important for footerSections and in NEST webapp it is also used for:
- perma link in sharing buttons (will be removed)
- showing feedback form (will be removed)
- showing info layer (welcome or beta) (will be removed)
- language selector (will be removed)
fields.deprecationReason: Returns always 'true', because all contents are live and accessible. This field will be removed in the future.

fields.name: showLiveWelcomeLayer
fields.description: This resolver checks if for a language a welcome layer should be shown in the frontend. Deprecated because migration process from classic to new dw.com is finished.
fields.deprecationReason: Migration process from classic to new dw.com is finished.

fields.name: posterImageLink
fields.description:
Returns the first simple resource link on videos, which contains e.g. video still URL.
If you expect to get poster image with all fallbacks implemented please consider
to use posterImageUrl resolver

fields.name: pageHeadline
fields.description:
A field that might be conditionally returned, like for navigation case. There some specific 
navigation types, such as thematic focus have the headline and null is returned otherwise.

fields.name: namedUrl
fields.description:
This resolver returns the named url part of the content.
Composed of language code, normalized name of content or friendly url part, model type prefix and content id combination.
Takes appName into account and renders full url with subdomain specific host if appname != subdomain of content.

fields.name: canonicalUrl
fields.description:
This resolver returns the canonical url of the content.
It is composed of a domain part that changes with content subdomain and the named url.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

fields.name: referenceTarget
fields.description: Returns target content of reference, which could be an ARTICLE, AUTO_TOPIC, AUDIO, VIDEO, IMAGE_GALLERY, NAVIGATION, PROGRAM, SERIES or EXTERNAL_LINK.

- language selector (will be removed)
fields.deprecationReason: Returns always 'true', because all contents are live and accessible. This field will be removed in the future.

fields.name: showLiveWelcomeLayer
fields.description: This resolver checks if for a language a welcome layer should be shown in the frontend. Deprecated because migration process from classic to new dw.com is finished.
fields.deprecationReason: Migration process from classic to new dw.com is finished.

fields.name: namedUrl
fields.description:
This resolver returns the named url part of the content.
Composed of language code, normalized name of content or friendly url part, model type prefix and content id combination.
Takes appName into account and renders full url with subdomain specific host if appname != subdomain of content.

fields.name: canonicalUrl
fields.description:
This resolver returns the canonical url of the content.
It is composed of a domain part that changes with content subdomain and the named url.

fields.description:

fields.name: showProgramsOverview
fields.description: This resolver checks if for the context language the ProgramsOverview page is available.

fields.name: showStreamingFeatures
fields.description: This resolver checks if for the context language streaming features are available.

fields.name: showSearch
fields.description: This resolver checks if for a language search is available. Takes language as parameter.

fields.name: appSearchBaseUrl
fields.description: Url needed for the clients to reach playout app search, different per stage

fields.name: reCaptchaSiteKey
fields.description:
Delivers the reCaptcha site key for each product. The reCaptcha site key is delivered and managed by Google.
Can be different for each product and stage.

fields.name: peachSiteKey
fields.description:
Sitekey delivered by PEACH team for peach collector. Required by peach tracking library.
Can be different per stage (e.g. live and test). Very likely each product should get its own set of sitekeys

fields.name: googleSiteVerificationKey
fields.description: Key for the google-site-verification meta data attribute. The same key can be used by all DW web apps.

fields.name: links
fields.deprecationReason: Use 'configurableLinks' instead. This field will be removed in the future.

fields.name: targetUrl
fields.description:
This resolver returns the url of the associated redirect if it exists.
Should work like the namedUrl resolver:
take appName into account and render full url with subdomain specific host if appName != subdomain of content.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Indicates exactly one field must be supplied and this field must not be `null`.
